description: SCOPE of Work: that is part of about 10+ sentences in the text that describes the work to be done and it can be paused here.
full_summary:
# Botsford Harbour – Containment Cell Tender Notice

## Reference Number
cb-166-69087352

## Solicitation Number
30005099

## Contracting Entity
Department of Fisheries and Oceans

## Regions of Delivery
New Brunswick

## Regions of Opportunity
Canada

## Expected Contract Period
December 6, 2023 – January 15, 2024

## Tender Status
Cancelled

## Scope of Work
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans invites proposals for the construction of a containment cell at the Botsford public wharf in Murray Corner, New Brunswick. The scope of work includes furnishing all necessary labour, materials, and services for the construction of the containment cell, including:

* Site preparation and excavation
* Supply and installation of R-5 and R-50 Rip Rap
* Supply and installation of G-2 and G-3 Geotextile
* Installation of containment cell drainage berm
* Supply and installation of silt curtain

## Additional Requirements
Mobilization and demobilization of equipment necessary for the project, as well as environmental controls, will be required. All work will be performed in accordance with the specifications and drawings provided with the tender package.

## Procurement Strategy
This tender will be conditionally set-aside under the Government of Canada's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) if two or more compliant bids from Indigenous businesses are received.

## Important Dates
* Tender Closing Date: December 1, 2023 at 2:00 PM AST
* Expected Contract Start Date: December 6, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: January 15, 2024

## Contact Information
Dina Al-Eryani
DFO
506-282-2340
Dina.Al-Eryani@dfo-mpo.gc.ca

## Attachments
A complete list of tender documents and attachments are available on the Canadabuys website.

Note: I made the following changes to reformat the text into a more concise and easy-to-read format:

* Removed irrelevant information (such as the notice URL and observation comments).
* Grouped similar information together (e.g., contracting entity and regions).
* Standardized the notation of dates and times.
* Improved sentence structure and clarity.
* Removed repetition and unnecessary words.
* Formatted the text using Markdown headers and lists.
